statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Courtney Sims score 20 points to lead Michigan to an 87-60 victory
over Central Michigan in the season opener for both teams.
article.headline: Sims, Abram help Michigan ease past Cent. Michigan
article.linkText: Sims, Abram help Michigan ease past Cent. Michigan
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Courtney Sims scored 20 points and Lester Abram added 19 Friday to lead Michigan to an 87-60 victory over Central Michigan in the season opener for both teams. Dion Harris also had 13 for the Wolverines, who never trailed in the game. Giordan Watson and Chris Kellermann scored 15 and 13 points, respectively, for the Chippewas, who are coached by former Michigan assistant coach Jay Smith. Trailing 44-26, Central Michigan opened the second half by forcing four Michigan turnovers and holding the Wolverines to 1-for-7 shooting from the field to pull to within 47-36 with 13:33 remaining. Watson sparked the run with 7 points. Michigan responded with six straight points to go ahead 53-36. The closest Central Michigan could get the rest of the way was 60-45 with 9:18 left. There were four ties in the first seven minutes. Michigan broke away from an 11-11 deadlock by scoring 17 of the next 20 points to open up a 28-14 lead. The Wolverines, who made 13 of 18 free throws in the half, later built their largest lead, 41-20.
